5.18. 
Conditions for making a will
1. The testator shall make a will freely and without coercion or mistake. The customary persuasion or request of interested heirs to make a will in their favour shall not be considered as coercion and shall not affect the validity of the will.
2. If the contents of the will make the testator's intention clear, errors in the wording of the will, inaccuracies in the naming of persons, or the change or disappearance of the character or position of any person or thing shall be irrelevant.
